content:
Assicurati che non sia l'antivirus (o altro software terzo) a rallentare Thunderbird. A parte questo non c'è molto da fare. Se la funzione ti è indispensabile e se con la versione precedente non avevi problemi, puoi anche valutare un downgrade -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/questions/1428585#answer-1613232

Potrebbe anche essere utile segnalare il tuo problema su Bugzilla -> https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/
creator: @next

content: Penso che segnalerò la cosa a Mozilla, comunque mi sono accorto che il rallentamento è disastroso con le cartelle che contengono le ricerche salvate. Per il resto è un po' più lento, ma insomma, si può resistere.

content:
Se non è riapparso ripristinando un backup, allora no. La causa potrebbe essere la corruzione di un file del profilo, ma con il ripristino vengono ripristinati tutti i file per cui mi sorprende che non funzioni.

Personalmente non ho altre idee. Se vuoi, puoi chiedere una seconda opinione riportando la domanda anche su https://forum.mozillaitalia.org/

Prova magari a seguire questa guida https://www.cronacheinformatiche.it/index.php/101-thunderbird-cestino-sparito ma solo dopo aver fatto un backup completo.
creator: @next

content: Niente da fare! Ho provato a creare la cartella "Cestino" ma il sistema mi risponde che la cartella è già esistente, anche se non è più visibile in Cart4elle Locali. Non c'è un altro modo per ricollegare tutte le cartelle a Thunderbird che non sia quello di cancellare global-messages-db.sqlite, cosa che non è servita a far riapparire la cartella "Cestino" che pure esiste sullo HD? Grazie.

content:
Si, il profilo comprende anche la struttura delle cartelle di Thunderbird. -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo

Una soluzione alternativa per esportare ed importare anche singoli gruppi di messaggi è l'uso dell'estensione ImportExportTools NG -> https://addons.thunderbird.net/it/thunderbird/addon/importexporttools-ng/

content: The message list pane has two options, table and card. The card view does not show the 'sort by date' feature. Look to the right of the 'quick filter' button and there is a small icon. Click it to change from card to table. Once there, you should see the date option,

content:
The reason you cannot read it is because the sender of original email put css code in email saying the text colour must be black, but they did not put any background colour because they expected you tobe using a white background automatically. So when you click on REply, that code is copied into the Reply email and if you use a dark background then you get the problem.

I use Dark Theme with the following settings, so my background is white by default when composing emails.

  • Settings > Composition
  • Under 'HTML Style' section
  • Do not select / uncheck 'Use readers default colours'
  • Set 'Text colour' as Black and 'background colour' as White
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Use this code in userChrome.css to set the density of context menus and Menu Bar menus when the default density is relaxed: 

/* context menus, menu bar density */ menupopup > :is(menu, menuitem) {     height: 15px !important; }
creator: sfhowes

content:
Windows 10 is required for version 116 and newer - current daily builds are version 121, so you cannot use it with Windows 7. Nor would I advise the average user to be using daily in any event.

I am not aware of any bug reports of a "jumping" issue with message preview, much less a fix. Please provide more details, and the bug report or specific statement about it if you have seen them.

content: Yes, Display Attachments Inline is checked and, as I noted in my post, they used to do so. Some update this year changed that. It also changed the way Thunderbird loads at startup. I keep my email folders collapsed but, for the last 3 months, Thunderbird expands them every time it loads.
creator: Rosaliy-Lynne

content:
The collapsed/expanded state of accounts in the Folder Pane is remembered here between restarts. See if this fixes that: Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Open Folder, close TB, delete or rename folderTree.json and session.json. Restart TB a few times and see if the folder state is retained.

For the inline images, if they are remote images, they will only be shown if View/Message Body As is Original HTML.
creator: sfhowes

Thanks for your input so far.
creator: Rosaliy-Lynne

content: If attached images display properly on some messages but not others, it indicates there's nothing wrong with your setup, but that some messages are formatted in such a way as to not display correctly. See if there's anything in the message source (Ctrl+U) to indicate the mailing app or OS, e.g. are the messages sent from a mobile app or a Mac device. Look at the Content-type header: is it image/jpeg or application/octet-stream.
creator: sfhowes

A jpg I sent out from my computer (I keep copies in case of send failure) displays correctly but that same image sent to me from a contractor, who sent it from his cell phone, did not display in line.

Rosaliy Lynne said
Yes, Display Attachments Inline is checked and, as I noted in my post, they used to do so. Some update this year changed that. It also changed the way Thunderbird loads at startup. I keep my email folders collapsed but, for the last 3 months, Thunderbird expands them every time it loads.

Since it wasn't broke - it would be nice if they FIX IT BACK.
creator: Rosaliy-Lynne

content: Are you saying View/Density/Compact is not available? I don't see that here, but it's possible it becomes disabled if the Font Size under View or in Settings/General/Language & Appearance exceeds a certain value, i.e. the Compact spacing is smaller than the font size. Testing with a new profile (Help/Troubleshooting, about:profiles) will start with all settings at their default.
creator: sfhowes

content:
I have checked all the above and nothing has changed. this change which forces my folders to expand when Thunderbird is launched came about with the changes to Thuderbird which replaced the get messages drop down with the cloud icon for that drop down and added the GET MESSAGES button. Prior to those changes all my mail folders remained closed until I would expand each one when checking new mail. I don't like that some programming genius took that functionality away!

fyi: my font has always been Times New Roman size 12 and still is so that is not an issue.

content: If the expanded/collapsed state of the folders is not retained between TB restarts, open the profile from Help/Troubleshooting, Profile Folder, Open Folder, close TB, delete folderTree.json. Check also that there's no app like CCleaner acting on TB to reset settings.
creator: sfhowes

content:
sfhowes said
The collapsed/expanded state of accounts in the Folder Pane is remembered here between restarts. See if this fixes that: Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Open Folder, close TB, delete or rename folderTree.json and session.json. Restart TB a few times and see if the folder state is retained. For the inline images, if they are remote images, they will only be shown if View/Message Body As is Original HTML.

I tried this and it worked for all of 2 days. Oh well.
creator: Rosaliy-Lynne

content: If you don't have some kind of app like CCleaner that resets TB settings like folderTree, consider creating a new profile, which might eliminate all of these issues. I do it for every major (annual) release to avoid issues with updating on old profiles. Help/Troubleshooting Info, about:profiles. After adding the accounts, it's fairly easy to transfer local mail, address books etc. from the old profile to the new.
creator: sfhowes

creator: jan.norwell

content:
Thank you for providing such great details.

I suggest picking your worst two issues and posting each in a new topic - volunteers often chose which topics they will spend time on by examining the title. I suggest your two compose issues - sending a link and the disappearing window.

> Unified Folders Debugging 115.3 addon ... but I noticed it gives a warning

This is just standard boiler plate wording. In practice add-ons provided are safe but the warning is required. This debugging addon in particular is written by a core trusted developer - the addon doesn't send any data outside of your computer and so is trustworthy.

Most of the other issues you list are known.
creator: wsmwk
